text: The shape of ammonia molecules is
explanation:
The ammonia (NH\(_3\)) molecule has a trigonal pyramidal shape, with the three hydrogen atoms and the nitrogen atom forming a pyramid, and a lone pair of electrons on the nitrogen atom.
Trigonal pyramidal and trigonal planar are distinct molecular geometries; trigonal planar has three atoms bonded to a central atom in a flat, triangular arrangement, while trigonal pyramidal has three atoms and one lone pair around the central atom, resulting in a pyramid shape.

text: The mass of silver deposited when a current of 10A is passed through a solution of silver salt for 4830s is – (Ag = 108 F = 96500(mol-1)
explanation:

text: Tin is unaffected by air at ordinary temperature due to its?
explanation:
Tin is unaffected by air even at ordinary temperature because it forms a thin, protective oxide layer on it's surface.
None of the options provided directly explain why tin is unaffected by air. However, for the sake of the examination and choosing the best among the four options, it will beweak electropositive character,as it implies that tin is less reactive.

text: The reaction of halogens with alkanes in the presence of sunlight is an example of
explanation:
Alkanes undergoes substitution reaction and it is an example of halogenation substitution reaction.Reaction of halogen with alkane in the presence of sunlight (ultraviolet) is termed halogenation. Halogenation is an example of substitution reaction. In addition, alkanes only undergo substitution reaction but not addition reaction.

text: The enzyme used in the hydrolysis of starch to dextrin and maltose is?
explanation:
Starch is hydrolyzed by dilute acids to yield a mixture of dextrin (a shorter chain intermediate product), disaccharides (mainly maltose) and glucose. Further hydrolysis will eventually give glucose. Hydrolysis of starch to dextrin and maltose can also be brought about by the enzyme amylase present in saliva and in malt.

text: Calculate the amount in moles of a gas which occupies 10.5 dm3 at 6 atm and 30oC [R = 0.082 atm dm3 K-1 mol-1]
explanation:
For an ideal gas PV = nRTAmount in moles = nVolume v = 10.5dm3Pressure P = 6atmTemperature T = 30°C + 273 = 303kR, Gas constant = 0.082 atmdm3k-1 molRecall from ideal gas equationpv = nRTn = \(\frac{RV}{RT}\)n = \(\frac{6 \times 10.5}{0.082 \times 303}\)n= 2.536mol

text: X(g) + 3Y(g) ---- 2z(g) H = +ve. if the reaction above takes place at room temperature, the G will be
explanation:
\(\begin{array}{c|c}\text{Enthalpy Change [ΔH]} & \text{Entropy Change [ΔS]} & \text{Gibbs free Energy[ΔG]} \\\hline\text{Positive} & \text{Positive} & \text{depends on T, may be + or -} \\ \hline \text{Negative} & \text{Positive} & \text{always negative} \\ \hline \text{Negative} & \text{Negative} & \text{depends on T, may be + or -} \\ \hline \text{Positive} & \text{Negative} & \text{always positive} \end{array}\)ΔG= ΔH − TΔS.To determine whether ΔG will be positive or negative, the value of ΔH(change in enthalpy) and ΔS (change in entropy) must be given. Likewise the temperature.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
